text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the whole congregation of Israelites, in their clans, by ancestral houses, according to the number of names, every male individually,
speaker: Narrator

text: from twenty years old and up, everyone in Israel able to go to war. You and Aaron shall enroll them, company by company.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man from each tribe shall be with you, each man the head of his ancestral house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the men who shall assist you:
From Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones chosen from the congregation, the leaders of their ancestral tribes, the heads of the divisions of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
speaker: Narrator

text: and on the first day of the second month they assembled the whole congregation together. They registered themselves in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and up, individually,
speaker: Narrator

text: as the Lord had commanded Moses. So he enrolled them in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, individually, every male from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Simeon, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, those of them who were numbered, according to the number of names, individually, every male from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Judah, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Judah were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Issachar, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Zebulun, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Joseph: the descendants of Ephraim, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred;
speaker: Narrator

text: the descendants of Manasseh, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Benjamin, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Dan, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Asher, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Asher were forty-one thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Naphtali, their lineage, in their clans, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war:
speaker: Narrator

text: those enrolled of the tribe of Naphtali were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were enrolled, whom Moses and Aaron enrolled with the help of the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each representing his ancestral house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all those enrolled of the Israelites, by their ancestral houses, from twenty years old and up, everyone able to go to war in Israel—
speaker: Narrator

text: all those enrolled were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, however, were not numbered by their ancestral tribe along with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not enroll, and you shall not take a census of them with the other Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, you shall appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the covenant and over all its equipment and over all that belongs to it; they are to carry the tabernacle and all its equipment, and they shall tend it and shall camp around the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up. And any outsider who comes near shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other Israelites shall camp in their respective regimental camps, by companies,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the covenant, that there may be no wrath on the congregation of the Israelites, and the Levites shall perform the duties of the tabernacle of the covenant.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did so; they did just as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Israelites shall camp each in their respective regiments, under ensigns by their ancestral houses; they shall camp facing the tent of meeting on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those to camp on the east side toward the sunrise shall be of the regimental encampment of Judah by companies. The leader of the people of Judah shall be Nahshon son of Amminadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of seventy-four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar. The leader of the Issacharites shall be Nethanel son of Zuar,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of fifty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribe of Zebulun. The leader of the Zebulunites shall be Eliab son of Helon,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment of the camp of Judah, by companies, is one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred. They shall set out first.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the south side shall be the regimental encampment of Reuben by companies. The leader of the Reubenites shall be Elizur son of Shedeur,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of forty-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon. The leader of the Simeonites shall be Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribe of Gad. The leader of the Gadites shall be Eliasaph son of Deuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment of the camp of Reuben, by companies, is one hundred fifty-one thousand four hundred fifty. They shall set out second.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The tent of meeting, with the camp of the Levites, shall set out in the center of the camps; they shall set out just as they camp, each in position, by their regiments.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the west side shall be the regimental encampment of Ephraim by companies. The leader of the people of Ephraim shall be Elishama son of Ammihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of forty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh. The leader of the people of Manasseh shall be Gamaliel son of Pedahzur,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of thirty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribe of Benjamin. The leader of the Benjaminites shall be Abidan son of Gideoni,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of thirty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment of the camp of Ephraim, by companies, is one hundred eight thousand one hundred. They shall set out third.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the north side shall be the regimental encampment of Dan by companies. The leader of the Danites shall be Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher. The leader of the Asherites shall be Pagiel son of Ochran,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of forty-one thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribe of Naphtali. The leader of the Naphtalites shall be Ahira son of Enan,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a company as enrolled of fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment of the camp of Dan is one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They shall set out last, by their regiments.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the enrollment of the Israelites by their ancestral houses; the total enrollment in the camps by their companies was six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, the Levites were not enrolled among the other Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did just as the Lord had commanded Moses: they camped by regiments, and they set out the same way, everyone by clans, according to ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the lineage of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar;
speaker: Narrator

text: these are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he ordained to serve as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered unholy fire before the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near and set them before Aaron the priest, so that they may assist him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall perform duties for him and for the whole congregation in front of the tent of meeting, doing service at the tabernacle;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall be in charge of all the furnishings of the tent of meeting and attend to the duties for the Israelites as they do service at the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give the Levites to Aaron and his descendants; they are unreservedly given to him from among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall enroll Aaron and his descendants; it is they who shall attend to the priesthood, and any outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I hereby take the Levites from among the Israelites as substitutes for all the firstborn that open the womb among the Israelites. The Levites shall be mine,
speaker: Narrator

text: for all the firstborn are mine; when I killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated for my own all the firstborn in Israel, both human and animal; they shall be mine. I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Enroll the Levites by ancestral houses and by clans. You shall enroll every male from a month old and up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses enrolled them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi, by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the names of the sons of Gershon by their clans: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath by their clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari by their clans: Mahli and Mushi. These were the clans of the Levites, by their ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites; these were the clans of the Gershonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their enrollment, counting all the males from a month old and up, was seven thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle on the west,
speaker: Narrator

text: with Eliasaph son of Lael as head of the ancestral house of the Gershonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The responsibility of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting was the tabernacle, the tent with its covering, the screen for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the court, the screen for the entrance of the court that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and its cords—all the service pertaining to these.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Kohath belonged the clan of the Amramites, the clan of the Izharites, the clan of the Hebronites, and the clan of the Uzzielites; these were the clans of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Counting all the males, from a month old and up, there were eight thousand six hundred performing the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of the Kohathites were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: with Elizaphan son of Uzziel as head of the ancestral house of the clans of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their responsibility was the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the vessels of the sanctuary with which the priests minister, and the screen—all the service pertaining to these.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar son of Aaron the priest was to be chief over the leaders of the Levites and to have oversight of those who performed the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Merari belonged the clan of the Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites; these were the clans of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their enrollment, counting all the males from a month old and up, was six thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The head of the ancestral house of the clans of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail; they were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The responsibility assigned to the sons of Merari was the frames of the tabernacle, the bars, the pillars, the bases, and all their accessories—all the service pertaining to these,
speaker: Narrator

text: also the pillars of the court all around, with their bases and pegs and cords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were to camp in front of the tabernacle on the east—in front of the tent of meeting toward the sunrise—were Moses and Aaron and Aaron’s sons, who were to perform the duties of the sanctuary, whatever had to be done for the Israelites, and any outsider who came near was to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment of the Levites whom Moses and Aaron enrolled at the commandment of the Lord, by their clans, all the males from a month old and up, was twenty-two thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Enroll all the firstborn males of the Israelites, from a month old and up, and count their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall take the Levites for me—I am the Lord—as substitutes for all the firstborn among the Israelites and the livestock of the Levites as substitutes for all the firstborn among the livestock of the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses enrolled all the firstborn among the Israelites, as the Lord commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total enrollment, all the firstborn males from a month old and up, counting the number of names, was twenty-two thousand two hundred seventy-three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites as substitutes for all the firstborn among the Israelites and the livestock of the Levites as substitutes for their livestock, and the Levites shall be mine. I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the price of redemption of the two hundred seventy-three of the firstborn of the Israelites, over and above the number of the Levites,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall take five shekels apiece, reckoning by the shekel of the sanctuary, a shekel of twenty gerahs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to Aaron and his sons the money by which the excess number of them is redeemed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those redeemed by the Levites;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the firstborn of the Israelites he took the money, one thousand three hundred sixty-five shekels, reckoned by the shekel of the sanctuary,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the Kohathites separate from the other Levites, by their clans and their ancestral houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, all who qualify to do work relating to the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The service of the Kohathites relating to the tent of meeting concerns the most holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the camp is to set out, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the screening curtain and cover the ark of the covenant with it;
speaker: Narrator

text: then they shall put on it a covering of fine leather and spread over that a cloth all of blue and put its poles in place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the table of the Presence they shall spread a blue cloth and put on it the plates, the dishes for incense, the bowls, and the flagons for the drink offering; the regular bread also shall be on it;
speaker: Narrator

text: then they shall spread over them a crimson cloth and cover it with a covering of fine leather and put its poles in place.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for the light, with its lamps, its snuffers, its trays, and all the vessels for oil with which it is supplied,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall put it with all its utensils in a covering of fine leather and put it on the carrying frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth and cover it with a covering of fine leather and put its poles in place,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall take all the utensils of the service that are used in the sanctuary and put them in a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of fine leather and put them on the carrying frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall put on it all the utensils of the altar, which are used for the service there, the firepans, the forks, the shovels, and the basins, all the utensils of the altar, and they shall spread on it a covering of fine leather and put its poles in place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, as the camp sets out, after that the Kohathites shall come to carry these, but they must not touch the holy things, or they will die. These are the things of the tent of meeting that the Kohathites are to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Eleazar son of Aaron the priest shall have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering, and the anointing oil, the oversight of all the tabernacle and all that is in it, in the sanctuary and in its utensils.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You must not let the tribe of the clans of the Kohathites be destroyed from among the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is how you shall deal with them in order that they may live and not die when they come near the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and assign each to a particular task or burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Kohathites must not go in to look on the holy things even for a moment, or they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the Gershonites also, by their ancestral houses and by their clans;
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old you shall enroll them, all who qualify to do work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the clans of the Gershonites, in serving and bearing burdens:
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the tent of meeting with its covering, and the outer covering of fine leather that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the entrance of the gate of the court that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and their cords, and all the equipment for their service, and they shall do all that needs to be done with regard to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the service of the Gershonites shall be at the command of Aaron and his sons, in all that they are to carry and in all that they have to do, and you shall assign to them as duties all that they are to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the clans of the Gershonites relating to the tent of meeting, and their duties are to be under the oversight of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for the Merarites, you shall enroll them by their clans and their ancestral houses;
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old you shall enroll them, everyone who qualifies to do the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is their duty to carry, as the whole of their service in the tent of meeting: the frames of the tabernacle, with its bars, pillars, and bases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars of the court all around with their bases, pegs, and cords, with all their equipment and all their related service, and you shall assign by name the objects that they are required to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the clans of the Merarites, the whole of their service relating to the tent of meeting, under the hand of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the congregation enrolled the Kohathites, by their clans and their ancestral houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who qualified for work relating to the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their enrollment by clans was two thousand seven hundred fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the enrollment of the clans of the Kohathites, all who served at the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron enrolled according to the commandment of the Lord by Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enrollment of the Gershonites, by their clans and their ancestral houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who qualified for work relating to the tent of meeting—
speaker: Narrator

text: their enrollment by their clans and their ancestral houses was two thousand six hundred thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the enrollment of the clans of the Gershonites, all who served at the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron enrolled according to the commandment of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enrollment of the clans of the Merarites, by their clans and their ancestral houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who qualified for work relating to the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their enrollment by their clans was three thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the enrollment of the clans of the Merarites, whom Moses and Aaron enrolled according to the commandment of the Lord by Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who were enrolled of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the leaders of Israel enrolled, by their clans and their ancestral houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, all who qualified to do the work of service and the work of bearing burdens relating to the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their enrollment was eight thousand five hundred eighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the commandment of the Lord through Moses, they were appointed to their several tasks of serving or carrying; thus they were enrolled by him, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites to put out of the camp everyone who has a defiling skin disease or a discharge and everyone who is unclean through contact with a corpse;
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall put out both male and female, putting them outside the camp; they must not defile their camp, where I dwell among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did so, putting them outside the camp; as the Lord had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites: When a man or a woman wrongs another, breaking faith with the Lord, that person incurs guilt
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall confess the sin that has been committed. The person shall make full restitution for the wrong, adding one-fifth to it and giving it to the one who was wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the injured party has no next of kin to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution for wrong shall go to the Lord for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement with which atonement is made for the guilty party.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among all the sacred donations of the Israelites, every gift that they bring to the priest shall be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacred donations of all are their own; whatever anyone gives to the priest shall be his.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: if a man has had intercourse with her but it is hidden from her husband, so that she is undetected though she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her since she was not caught in the act;
speaker: Narrator

text: if a spirit of jealousy comes on him and he is jealous of his wife who has defiled herself, or if a spirit of jealousy comes on him and he is jealous of his wife, though she has not defiled herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring the offering required for her, one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He shall pour no oil on it and put no frankincense on it, for it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the priest shall bring her near and set her before the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: the priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel and take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall set the woman before the Lord, dishevel the woman’s hair, and place in her hands the grain offering of remembrance, which is the grain offering of jealousy. In his own hand the priest shall have the water of bitterness that brings the curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall make her take an oath, saying, ‘If no man has lain with you, if you have not turned aside to uncleanness while under your husband’s authority, be immune to this water of bitterness that brings the curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you have gone astray while under your husband’s authority, if you have defiled yourself and some man other than your husband has had intercourse with you,’
speaker: Narrator

text: —let the priest make the woman take the oath of the curse and say to the woman—‘the Lord make you an execration and an oath among your people, when the Lord makes your uterus drop, your womb discharge;
speaker: Narrator

text: now may this water that brings the curse enter your bowels and make your womb discharge, your uterus drop!’ And the woman shall say, ‘Amen. Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the priest shall put these curses in writing and wash them off into the water of bitterness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that brings the curse, and the water that brings the curse shall enter her and cause bitter pain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy out of the woman’s hand and shall elevate the grain offering before the Lord and bring it to the altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priest shall take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial portion and turn it into smoke on the altar and afterward shall make the woman drink the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has made her drink the water, then, if she has defiled herself and has been unfaithful to her husband, the water that brings the curse shall enter into her and cause bitter pain, and her womb shall discharge, her uterus drop, and the woman shall become an execration among her people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, then she shall be immune and be able to conceive children.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the law in cases of jealousy, when a wife, while under her husband’s authority, goes astray and defiles herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: or when a spirit of jealousy comes on a man and he is jealous of his wife, then he shall set the woman before the Lord, and the priest shall apply this entire law to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man shall be free from iniquity, but the woman shall bear her iniquity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: When either men or women make a special vow, the vow of a nazirite, to separate themselves to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall separate themselves from wine and strong drink; they shall drink no wine vinegar or other vinegar and shall not drink any grape juice or eat grapes, fresh or dried.
speaker: Narrator

text: All their days as nazirites they shall eat nothing that is produced by the grapevine, not even the seeds or the skins.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the days of their nazirite vow no razor shall come upon the head; until the time is completed for which they separate themselves to the Lord, they shall be holy; they shall let the locks of the head grow long.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the days that they separate themselves to the Lord they shall not go near a corpse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if their father or mother, brother or sister, should die, they may not defile themselves, because their consecration to God is upon the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: All their days as nazirites they are holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If someone suddenly dies nearby, defiling the head of the nazirite, then they shall shave the head on the day of their cleansing; on the seventh day they shall shave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day they shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priest shall offer one as a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering and make atonement for them, because they incurred guilt by reason of the corpse. They shall sanctify the head that same day
speaker: Narrator

text: and separate themselves to the Lord for their days as nazirites and bring a male lamb a year old as a guilt offering. The former time shall be void because the nazarite was defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the law for the nazirites when the time of their consecration has been completed: they shall be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall offer their gift to the Lord, one male lamb a year old without blemish as a burnt offering, one ewe lamb a year old without blemish as a purification offering, one ram without blemish as an offering of well-being,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of choice flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, with their grain offering and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall present them before the Lord and offer their purification offering and burnt offering
speaker: Narrator

text: and offer the ram as a sacrifice of well-being to the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread; the priest also shall make the accompanying grain offering and drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the nazirites shall shave the consecrated head at the entrance of the tent of meeting and shall take the hair from the consecrated head and put it on the fire under the sacrifice of well-being.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take the shoulder of the ram, when it is boiled, and one unleavened cake out of the basket and one unleavened wafer and shall put them in the palms of the nazirites, after they have shaved the consecrated head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the Lord; they are a holy portion for the priest, together with the breast that is elevated and the thigh that is offered. After that the nazirites may drink wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the law for the nazirites who take a vow. Their offering to the Lord must be in accordance with the nazirite vow, apart from what else they can afford. In accordance with whatever vow they take, so they shall do, following the law for their consecration.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying: Thus you shall bless the Israelites: You shall say to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord bless you and keep you;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So they shall put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day when Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle and had anointed and consecrated it with all its furnishings and had anointed and consecrated the altar with all its utensils,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses,

speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the wagons and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the Gershonites, according to their service,

speaker: Narrator

text: But to the Kohathites he gave none, because they were charged with the care of the holy things that had to be carried on the shoulders.

text: The leaders also presented offerings for the dedication of the altar at the time when it was anointed; the leaders presented their offering before the altar.

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator
