text: He sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor, which is on the Euphrates, in the land of Amaw, to summon him, saying, “A people has come out of Egypt; they have spread over the face of the earth, and they have settled next to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come now, curse this people for me, since they are stronger than I; perhaps I shall be able to defeat them and drive them from the land, for I know that whomever you bless is blessed, and whomever you curse is cursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the fees for divination in their hand, and they came to Balaam and gave him Balak’s message.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Stay here tonight, and I will bring back word to you, just as the Lord speaks to me”; so the officials of Moab stayed with Balaam.
speaker: Narrator

text: God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to God, “King Balak son of Zippor of Moab has sent me this message:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Look, a people has come out of Egypt and has spread over the face of the earth; now come, curse them for me; perhaps I shall be able to fight against them and drive them out.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them; you shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam rose in the morning and said to the officials of Balak, “Go to your own land, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the officials of Moab rose and went to Balak and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Once again Balak sent officials, more numerous and more distinguished than these.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor: Do not let anything hinder you from coming to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I will surely do you great honor, and whatever you say to me I will do; come, curse this people for me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Balaam replied to the servants of Balak, “Although Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the command of the Lord my God, to do less or more.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also stay here overnight, so that I may learn what more the Lord may say to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That night God came to Balaam and said to him, “If the men have come to summon you, get up and go with them, but do only what I tell you to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the officials of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s anger was kindled because he was going, and the angel of the Lord took his stand in the road as his adversary. Now he was riding on the donkey, and his two servants were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road, with a drawn sword in his hand, so the donkey turned off the road and went into the field, and Balaam struck the donkey, to turn it back onto the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, with a wall on either side.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it scraped against the wall and scraped Balaam’s foot against the wall, so he struck it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord went ahead and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it lay down under Balaam, and Balaam’s anger was kindled, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and it said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have made a fool of me! I wish I had a sword in my hand! I would kill you right now!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey, which you have ridden all your life to this day? Have I been in the habit of treating you this way?” And he said, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road, with his drawn sword in his hand, and he bowed down, falling on his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? I have come out as an adversary because your way is perverse before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If it had not turned away from me, surely just now I would have killed you and let it live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you were standing in the road to oppose me. Now therefore, if it is displeasing to you, I will return home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but speak only what I tell you to speak.” So Balaam went on with the officials of Balak.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him at Ir-moab, on the boundary formed by the Arnon, at the farthest point of the boundary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not send to summon you? Why did you not come to me? Am I not able to honor you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “I have come to you now, but do I have power to say just anything? The word God puts in my mouth, that is what I must say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep and sent them to Balaam and to the officials who were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day Balak took Balaam and brought him up to Bamoth-baal, and from there he could see part of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak did as Balaam had said and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your burnt offerings while I go aside. Perhaps the Lord will come to meet me. Whatever he shows me I will tell you.” And he went to a bare height.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God met Balaam, and Balaam said to him, “I have arranged the seven altars and have offered a bull and a ram on each altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and this is what you must say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he returned to Balak, who was standing beside his burnt offerings with all the officials of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Balaam uttered his oracle, saying,
“Balak has brought me from Aram,
    the king of Moab from the eastern mountains:
‘Come, curse Jacob for me.
    Come, denounce Israel!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can I curse whom God has not cursed?
    How can I denounce those whom the Lord has not denounced?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For from the top of the crags I see him;
    from the hills I behold him.
Here is a people living alone
    and not reckoning itself among the nations!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can count the dust of Jacob
    or number the dust cloud of Israel?
Let me die the death of the upright,
    and let my end be like his!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but now you have done nothing but bless them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Must I not take care to say what the Lord puts into my mouth?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place from which you may see them; you shall see only part of them and shall not see them all; then curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah. He built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Stand here beside your burnt offerings, while I meet the Lord over there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord met Balaam, put a word into his mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and this is what you shall say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to him, he was standing beside his burnt offerings with the officials of Moab. Balak said to him, “What has the Lord said?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God is not a human being, that he should lie,
    or a mortal, that he should change his mind.
Has he promised, and will he not do it?
    Has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I received a command to bless;
    he has blessed, and I cannot revoke it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not beheld misfortune in Jacob,
    nor has he seen trouble in Israel.
The Lord their God is with them,
    acclaimed as a king among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, who brings them out of Egypt,
    is like the horns of a wild ox for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob,
    no divination against Israel;
now it shall be said of Jacob and Israel,
    ‘See what God has done!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, a people rising up like a lioness
    and rousing itself like a lion!
It does not lie down until it has eaten the prey
    and drunk the blood of the slain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all, and do not bless them at all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Balaam answered Balak, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘Whatever the Lord says, that is what I must do’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balak did as Balaam had said and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, so he did not go, as at other times, to look for omens but set his face toward the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam looked up and saw Israel camping tribe by tribe. Then the spirit of God came upon him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and he uttered his oracle, saying,
“The oracle of Balaam son of Beor,
    the oracle of the man whose eye is clear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the oracle of one who hears the words of God,
    who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    who falls down but with eyes uncovered:
speaker: Narrator

text:
How fair are your tents, O Jacob,
    your encampments, O Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like palm groves that stretch far away,
    like gardens beside a river,
like aloes that the Lord has planted,
    like cedar trees beside the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Water shall flow from his buckets,
    and his seed shall have abundant water;
his king shall be higher than Agag,
    and his kingdom shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, who brings him out of Egypt,
    is like the horns of a wild ox for him;
he shall devour the nations that are his foes
    and break their bones.
    He shall strike with his arrows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He crouched; he lay down like a lion
    and like a lioness; who will rouse him up?
Blessed is everyone who blesses you,
    and cursed is everyone who curses you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. Balak said to Balaam, “I summoned you to curse my enemies, but instead you have blessed them these three times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now be off with you! Go home! I said, ‘I will reward you richly,’ but the Lord has denied you any reward.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not speak to your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If Balak should give me his house full of silver and gold, I would not be able to go beyond the word of the Lord, to do either good or bad of my own will; what the Lord says, that is what I will say’?
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, I am going to my people; let me advise you what this people will do to your people in days to come.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he uttered his oracle, saying,
“The oracle of Balaam son of Beor,
    the oracle of the man whose eye is clear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the oracle of one who hears the words of God
    and knows the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    who falls down but with eyes uncovered:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Edom will become a possession,
    Seir a possession of its enemies,
    while Israel does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One out of Jacob shall rule
    and destroy the survivors of Ir.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he looked on Amalek and uttered his oracle, saying,
“First among the nations was Amalek,
but its end is to perish forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he looked on the Kenite and uttered his oracle, saying,
“Enduring is your dwelling place,
    and your nest is set in the rock,
speaker: Narrator

text:
yet Kain is destined for burning.
    How long shall Asshur take you away captive?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again he uttered his oracle, saying,
“Alas, who shall live when God does this?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But ships shall come from Kittim
and shall afflict Asshur and Eber,
    and he also shall perish forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam got up and went back to his place, and Balak also went his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Israel was staying at Shittim, the people began to have sexual relations with the women of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: These invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Israel yoked itself to the Baal of Peor, and the Lord’s anger was kindled against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take all the chiefs of the people and impale them in the sun before the Lord, in order that the fierce anger of the Lord may turn away from Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Each of you shall kill any of your people who have yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then one of the Israelites came and brought a Midianite woman into his family, in the sight of Moses and in the sight of the whole congregation of the Israelites, while they were weeping at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Phinehas son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he got up and left the congregation. Taking a spear in his hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: he went after the Israelite man into the tent and pierced the two of them, the Israelite and the woman, through the belly. So the plague was stopped among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Phinehas son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, has turned back my wrath from the Israelites by manifesting such zeal among them on my behalf that in my jealousy I did not consume the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say, ‘I hereby grant him my covenant of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be for him and for his descendants after him a covenant of perpetual priesthood, because he was zealous for his God and made atonement for the Israelites.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the slain Israelite man who was killed with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, head of an ancestral house belonging to the Simeonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi daughter of Zur, who was the head of a clan, an ancestral house in Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Harass the Midianites, and defeat them,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they have harassed you by the trickery with which they deceived you in the affair of Peor, and in the affair of Cozbi, the daughter of a leader of Midian, their sister; she was killed on the day of the plague that resulted from Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the plague the Lord said to Moses and to Eleazar the priest,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the whole congregation of the Israelites, from twenty years old and up, by their ancestral houses, everyone in Israel able to go to war.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Take a census of the people, from twenty years old and up,” as the Lord commanded Moses.
The Israelites who came out of the land of Egypt were:
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel. The descendants of Reuben: of Hanoch, the clan of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the Reubenites; the number of those enrolled was forty-three thousand seven hundred thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the descendants of Pallu: Eliab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram, chosen from the congregation, who rebelled against Moses and Aaron in the congregation of Korah, when they rebelled against the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up along with Korah, when that congregation died, when the fire devoured two hundred fifty men, and they became a warning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, the sons of Korah did not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Simeon by their clans: of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the clan of the Jachinites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the clan of the Shaulites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the Simeonites: twenty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad by their clans: of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Arod, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the descendants of Gad by the number of those enrolled: forty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan; Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Judah by their clans were: of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Perez were: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of Judah by the number of those enrolled: seventy-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Issachar by their clans: of Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Punites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of Issachar by the number of those enrolled: sixty-four thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Zebulun by their clans: of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the Zebulunites by the number of those enrolled: sixty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joseph by their clans: Manasseh and Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Manasseh: of Machir, the clan of the Machirites; and Machir was the father of Gilead; of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the descendants of Gilead: of Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and of Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and of Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons, only daughters, and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of Manasseh; the number of those enrolled was fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the descendants of Ephraim according to their clans: of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the clan of the Becherites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the descendants of Shuthelah: of Eran, the clan of the Eranites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the Ephraimites by the number of those enrolled: thirty-two thousand five hundred. These are the descendants of Joseph by their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Benjamin by their clans: of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the descendants of Benjamin by their clans; the number of those enrolled was forty-five thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the descendants of Dan by their clans: of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. These are the clans of Dan by their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the clans of the Shuhamites by the number of those enrolled: sixty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Asher by their clans: of Imnah, the clan of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the descendants of Beriah: of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the clan of the Malchielites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of the descendants of Asher by the number of those enrolled: fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Naphtali by their clans: of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of Naphtali by their clans; the number of those enrolled was forty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the number of the Israelites enrolled: six hundred and one thousand seven hundred thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “To these the land shall be apportioned for inheritance according to the number of names.
speaker: Narrator

text: To a large tribe you shall give a large inheritance, and to a small tribe you shall give a small inheritance; every tribe shall be given its inheritance according to its enrollment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land shall be apportioned by lot; according to the names of their ancestral tribes they shall inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their inheritance shall be apportioned according to lot between the larger and the smaller.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the enrollment of the Levites by their clans: of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the clans of Levi: the clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites. Now Kohath was the father of Amram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt, and she bore to Amram: Aaron, Moses, and their sister Miriam.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Aaron were born Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unholy fire before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The number of those enrolled was twenty-three thousand, every male one month old and up, for they were not enrolled among the Israelites because there was no allotment given to them among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were those enrolled by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who enrolled the Israelites in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among these there was not one of those enrolled by Moses and Aaron the priest, who had enrolled the Israelites in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had said of them, “They shall die in the wilderness.” Not one of them was left, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad came forward. Zelophehad was son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh, of the clans of Manasseh, son of Joseph. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and all the congregation, at the entrance of the tent of meeting, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our father died in the wilderness; he was not among the congregation of those who gathered themselves together against the Lord in the congregation of Korah but died for his own sin, and he had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the name of our father be taken away from his clan because he had no son? Give to us a possession among our father’s brothers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses brought their case before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The daughters of Zelophehad are right in what they are saying; you shall indeed let them possess an inheritance among their father’s brothers and pass the inheritance of their father on to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also speak to the Israelites, saying: If a man dies and has no son, then you shall pass his inheritance on to his daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to the nearest kinsman of his clan, and he shall possess it. It shall be for the Israelites a statute and ordinance, as the Lord commanded Moses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go up this mountain of the Abarim range, and see the land that I have given to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as your brother Aaron was,
speaker: Narrator

text: because you rebelled against my word in the wilderness of Zin when the congregation quarreled with me. You did not show my holiness before their eyes at the waters.” (These are the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint someone over the congregation
speaker: Narrator

text: who shall go out before them and come in before them, who shall lead them out and bring them in, so that the congregation of the Lord may not be like sheep without a shepherd.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay your hand upon him;
speaker: Narrator

text: have him stand before Eleazar the priest and all the congregation and commission him in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give him some of your authority, so that all the congregation of the Israelites may obey.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the decision of the Urim before the Lord; at his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the Israelites with him, the whole congregation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses did as the Lord commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole congregation;
speaker: Narrator

text: he laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the Lord had directed through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites, and say to them: My offering, the food for my offerings by fire, my pleasing odor, you shall take care to offer to me at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall say to them: This is the offering by fire that you shall offer to the Lord: two male lambs a year old without blemish, daily, as a regular offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one-tenth of an ephah of choice flour for a grain offering, mixed with one-fourth of a hin of beaten oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a regular burnt offering, ordained at Mount Sinai for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its drink offering shall be one-fourth of a hin for each lamb; in the sanctuary you shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight with a grain offering and a drink offering like the one in the morning; you shall offer it as an offering by fire, a pleasing odor to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the Sabbath day: two male lambs a year old without blemish and two-tenths of an ephah of choice flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, and its drink offering—
speaker: Narrator

text: this is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the beginnings of your months you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;
speaker: Narrator

text: also three-tenths of an ephah of choice flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for each bull; and two-tenths of choice flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram;
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth of choice flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for each lamb—a burnt offering of pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, one-third of a hin for a ram, and one-fourth of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be one male goat for a purification offering to the Lord; it shall be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the fourteenth day of the first month there shall be a Passover offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the fifteenth day of this month is a festival; seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation. You shall not work at your occupations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer an offering by fire, a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old; see that they are without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering shall be of choice flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah shall you offer for a bull and two-tenths for a ram;
speaker: Narrator

text: one-tenth shall you offer for each of the seven lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, to make atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer these in addition to the burnt offering of the morning, which belongs to the regular burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way you shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of an offering by fire, a pleasing odor to the Lord; it shall be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation; you shall not work at your occupations.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the day of the first fruits, when you offer a grain offering of new grain to the Lord at your Festival of Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall not work at your occupations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer a burnt offering, a pleasing odor to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering shall be of choice flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: one-tenth for each of the seven lambs,
speaker: Narrator

text: with one male goat, to make atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, you shall offer them and their drink offering. They shall be without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the first day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation; you shall not work at your occupations. It is a day for you to blow the trumpets,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall offer a burnt offering, a pleasing odor to the Lord: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering shall be of choice flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs,
speaker: Narrator

text: with one male goat for a purification offering, to make atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon and its grain offering, and the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offerings, according to the ordinance for them, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation and humble yourselves; you shall do no work.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord, a pleasing odor: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old. They shall be without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering shall be of choice flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: one-tenth for each of the seven lambs,
speaker: Narrator

text: with one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the purification offering of atonement, and the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation; you shall not work at your occupations. You shall celebrate a festival to the Lord seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer a burnt offering, an offering by fire, a pleasing odor to the Lord: thirteen young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old. They shall be without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering shall be of choice flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each of the two rams,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the second day: twelve young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the fourth day: ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly; you shall not work at your occupations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer a burnt offering, an offering by fire, a pleasing odor to the Lord: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, as prescribed in accordance with their number;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one male goat for a purification offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed festivals, in addition to your votive offerings and your freewill offerings, as your burnt offerings, your grain offerings, your drink offerings, and your offerings of well-being.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses told the Israelites everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the Israelites, saying, “This is what the Lord has commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man makes a vow to the Lord or swears an oath to bind himself by a pledge, he shall not break his word; he shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a woman makes a vow to the Lord or binds herself by a pledge while within her father’s house, in her youth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her father hears of her vow or her pledge by which she has bound herself and says nothing to her, then all her vows shall stand, and any pledge by which she has bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her father overrules her at the time that he hears of it, no vow of hers and no pledge by which she has bound herself shall stand, and the Lord will forgive her because her father overruled her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If she marries, while obligated by her vows or any thoughtless utterance of her lips by which she has bound herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband hears of it and says nothing to her at the time that he hears, then her vows shall stand, and her pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if, at the time that her husband hears of it, he overrules her, then he shall nullify the vow by which she was obligated or the thoughtless utterance of her lips by which she bound herself, and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But every vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, by which she has bound herself, shall be binding upon her.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And if she made a vow in her husband’s house or bound herself by a pledge with an oath
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband heard it and said nothing to her and did not overrule her, then all her vows shall stand, and any pledge by which she bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband nullifies them at the time that he hears them, then whatever proceeds out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning her pledge shall not stand. Her husband has nullified them, and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Any vow or any binding oath to humble herself, her husband may allow to stand or her husband may nullify.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he validates all her vows or all her pledges by which she is obligated; he has validated them because he said nothing to her at the time that he heard of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he nullifies them some time after he has heard of them, then he shall bear her guilt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes that the Lord commanded Moses concerning a husband and his wife and a father and his daughter while she is still young and in her father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Avenge the Israelites on the Midianites; afterward you shall be gathered to your people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm some of your number for the war, so that they may go against Midian, to execute the Lord’s vengeance on Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall send a thousand from each of the tribes of Israel to the war.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe were conscripted, twelve thousand armed for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them to the war, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for sounding the alarm in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did battle against Midian, as the Lord had commanded Moses, and killed every male.
speaker: Narrator

text: They killed the kings of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian, in addition to others who were slain by them, and they also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites took the women of Midian and their little ones captive, and they plundered all their cattle, their flocks, and all their goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: All their towns where they had settled, and all their encampments, they burned,
speaker: Narrator

text: but they took all the spoil and all the plunder, both people and animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought the captives and the plunder and the spoil to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the Israelites, at the camp on the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the congregation went to meet them outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses became angry with the officers of the army, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, who had come from service in the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “Have you allowed all the women to live?
speaker: Narrator

text: These women here, on Balaam’s advice, made the Israelites act treacherously against the Lord in the affair of Peor, so that the plague came among the congregation of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known a man by sleeping with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the young girls who have not known a man by sleeping with him, keep alive for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Camp outside the camp seven days, whoever of you has killed any person or touched a corpse; purify yourselves, you and your captives, on the third and on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall purify every garment, every article of skin, everything made of goats’ hair, and every article of wood.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar the priest said to the troops who had gone to battle, “This is the statute of the law that the Lord has commanded Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead—
speaker: Narrator

text: everything that can withstand fire, you shall pass through fire, and it shall be clean. Nevertheless, it shall also be purified with the water for purification, and whatever cannot withstand fire, you shall pass through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean; afterward you may come into the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You and Eleazar the priest and the heads of the ancestral houses of the congregation make an inventory of the plunder captured, both human and animal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Divide the plunder into two parts, between the warriors who went out to battle and all the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the share of the warriors who went out to battle, set aside as tribute for the Lord one item out of every five hundred, whether persons, oxen, donkeys, or sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take it from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from the Israelites’ half you shall take one out of every fifty, whether persons, oxen, donkeys, or sheep—all the animals—and give them to the Levites, who perform the duties of the tabernacle of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plunder remaining from the spoils that the troops had taken totaled six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: seventy-two thousand oxen,
speaker: Narrator

text: sixty-one thousand donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, women who had not known a man by sleeping with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half-share, the portion of those who had gone out to war, was in number three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord’s tribute of sheep was six hundred seventy-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The oxen were thirty-six thousand, of which the Lord’s tribute was seventy-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which the Lord’s tribute was sixty-one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The persons were sixteen thousand, of which the Lord’s tribute was thirty-two persons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave the tribute, the offering for the Lord, to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Israelites’ half, which Moses separated from that of the troops,
speaker: Narrator

text: the congregation’s half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: thirty-six thousand oxen,
speaker: Narrator

text: thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sixteen thousand persons.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ half Moses took one of every fifty, both of persons and of animals, and gave them to the Levites, who perform the duties of the tabernacle of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, approached Moses
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to Moses, “Your servants have counted the warriors who are under our command, and not one of us is missing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have brought the Lord’s offering, what each of us found, articles of gold, armlets and bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and pendants, to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from them, all in the form of crafted articles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the gold of the offering that they offered to the Lord, from the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The troops had all taken plunder for themselves.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and of hundreds and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Reubenites and the Gadites owned a very great number of cattle. When they saw that the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead was a good place for cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Gadites and the Reubenites came and spoke to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the leaders of the congregation, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—
speaker: Narrator

text: the land that the Lord subdued before the congregation of Israel—is a land for cattle, and your servants have cattle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They continued, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession; do not make us cross the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said to the Gadites and to the Reubenites, “Shall your brothers go to war while you sit here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why will you discourage the hearts of the Israelites from going over into the land that the Lord has given them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers did this, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went up to the Wadi Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the hearts of the Israelites from going into the land that the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s anger was kindled on that day, and he swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Surely none of the people who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and up, shall see the land that I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they have not unreservedly followed me—
speaker: Narrator

text: none except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they have unreservedly followed the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord’s anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness for forty years, until all the generation that had done evil in the sight of the Lord had disappeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now you, a brood of sinners, have risen in place of your fathers, to increase the Lord’s fierce anger against Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text: If you turn away from following him, he will again abandon them in the wilderness, and you will destroy all this people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came up to him and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our flocks and towns for our little ones,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we will take up arms as a vanguard before the Israelites, until we have brought them to their place. Meanwhile our little ones will stay in the fortified towns because of the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not return to our homes until all the Israelites have obtained their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan to the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to them, “If you do this—if you take up arms to go before the Lord for the war
speaker: Narrator

text: and all those of you who bear arms cross the Jordan before the Lord, until he has driven out his enemies from before him
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land is subdued before the Lord—then after that you may return and be free of obligation to the Lord and to Israel, and this land shall be your possession before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not do this, you have sinned against the Lord, and be sure your sin will find you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Build towns for your little ones and folds for your flocks, but do what you have promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Gadites and the Reubenites said to Moses, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock shall remain there in the towns of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: but your servants will cross over, everyone armed for war, to do battle for the Lord, just as my lord orders.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave command concerning them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelite tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to them, “If the Gadites and the Reubenites, everyone armed for battle before the Lord, will cross over the Jordan with you and the land shall be subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if they will not cross over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gadites and the Reubenites answered, saying, “As the Lord has spoken to your servants, so we will do.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will cross over armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan, but the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us on this side of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave to them—to the Gadites and to the Reubenites and to the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph—the kingdom of King Sihon of the Amorites and the kingdom of King Og of Bashan, the land and its towns, with the territories of the surrounding towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gadites rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran, fortified cities, and folds for sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebo, and Baal-meon (some names being changed), and Sibmah, and they gave names to the towns that they rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, captured it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were there,
speaker: Narrator

text: so Moses gave Gilead to Machir son of Manasseh, and he settled there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair son of Manasseh went and captured their villages and renamed them Havvoth-jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages and renamed it Nobah after himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the stages by which the Israelites went out of the land of Egypt in military formation under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses wrote down their starting points, stage by stage, by command of the Lord, and these are their stages according to their starting places.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the day after the Passover the Israelites went out boldly in the sight of all the Egyptians,
speaker: Narrator

text: while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down among them. The Lord executed judgments even against their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites set out from Rameses and camped at Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Succoth and camped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon, and they camped before Migdol.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Pi-hahiroth, passed through the sea into the wilderness, went a three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and camped at Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Marah and came to Elim; at Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Red Sea and camped in the wilderness of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rephidim and camped in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Ezion-geber and camped in the wilderness of Zin (that is, Kadesh).
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor at the command of the Lord and died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the Negeb in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, in the territory of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Iyim and camped at Dibon-gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho;
speaker: Narrator

text: they camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them: When you cross over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, destroy all their figured stones, destroy all their cast images, and demolish all their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall apportion the land by lot according to your clans; to a large one you shall give a large inheritance, and to a small one you shall give a small inheritance; the inheritance shall belong to the person on whom the lot falls; according to your ancestral tribes you shall apportion it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those whom you let remain shall be as barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides; they shall trouble you in the land where you are settling.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will do to you as I thought to do to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites, and say to them: When you enter the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan, defined by its boundaries),
speaker: Narrator

text: your south sector shall extend from the wilderness of Zin along the side of Edom. Your southern boundary shall begin from the end of the Dead Sea on the east;
speaker: Narrator

text: your boundary shall turn south of the ascent of Akrabbim and cross to Zin, and its outer limit shall be south of Kadesh-barnea; then it shall go on to Hazar-addar and cross to Azmon;
speaker: Narrator

text: the boundary shall turn from Azmon to the Wadi of Egypt, and its termination shall be at the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For the western boundary, you shall have the Great Sea and its coast; this shall be your western boundary.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This shall be your northern boundary: from the Great Sea you shall mark out your line to Mount Hor;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Mount Hor you shall mark it out to Lebo-hamath, and the outer limit of the boundary shall be at Zedad;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary shall extend to Ziphron, and its end shall be at Hazar-enan; this shall be your northern boundary.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall mark out your eastern boundary from Hazar-enan to Shepham,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary shall continue down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain, and the boundary shall go down and reach the eastern slope of the sea of Chinnereth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary shall go down to the Jordan, and its end shall be at the Dead Sea. This shall be your land with its boundaries all around.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the Israelites, saying, “This is the land that you shall apportion by lot, which the Lord has commanded to give to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the tribe of the Reubenites by their ancestral houses and the tribe of the Gadites by their ancestral houses have taken their inheritance and also the half-tribe of Manasseh;
speaker: Narrator

text: the two tribes and the half-tribe have taken their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the names of the men who shall apportion the land to you for inheritance: the priest Eleazar and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take one leader of every tribe to apportion the land for inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the Simeonites, Shemuel son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Chislon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the Danites a leader, Bukki son of Jogli.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Josephites: of the tribe of the Manassites a leader, Hanniel son of Ephod,
speaker: Narrator

text: and of the tribe of the Ephraimites a leader, Kemuel son of Shiphtan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the Zebulunites a leader, Eli-zaphan son of Parnach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the Issacharites a leader, Paltiel son of Azzan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the tribe of the Asherites a leader, Ahihud son of Shelomi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the Naphtalites a leader, Pedahel son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones whom the Lord commanded to apportion the inheritance for the Israelites in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites to give, from the inheritance that they possess, towns for the Levites to live in; you shall also give to the Levites pasturelands surrounding the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns shall be theirs to live in, and their pasturelands shall be for their cattle, for their livestock, and for all their animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pasture lands of the towns, which you shall give to the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the town outward a thousand cubits all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall measure, outside the town, for the east side two thousand cubits, for the south side two thousand cubits, for the west side two thousand cubits, and for the north side two thousand cubits, with the town in the middle; this shall belong to them as pastureland for their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The towns that you give to the Levites shall include the six cities of refuge, where you shall permit a slayer to flee, and in addition to them you shall give forty-two towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns that you give to the Levites shall total forty-eight, with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the towns that you shall give from the possession of the Israelites, from the larger tribes you shall take many, and from the smaller tribes you shall take few; each, in proportion to the inheritance that it obtains, shall give of its towns to the Levites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall select cities to be cities of refuge for you, so that a slayer who kills a person without intent may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities shall be for you a refuge from the avenger, so that the slayer may not die until there is a trial before the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The cities that you designate shall be six cities of refuge for you:
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall designate three cities beyond the Jordan, and three cities in the land of Canaan, to be cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six cities shall serve as refuge for the Israelites, for the resident or transient alien among them, so that anyone who kills a person without intent may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But anyone who strikes another with an iron object, and death ensues, is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or anyone who strikes another with a stone in hand that could cause death, and death ensues, is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or anyone who strikes another with a weapon of wood in hand that could cause death, and death ensues, is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The avenger of blood is the one who shall put the murderer to death; when they meet, the avenger of blood shall execute the sentence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, if someone pushes another from hatred or hurls something at another, lying in wait, and death ensues,
speaker: Narrator

text: or in enmity strikes another with the hand, and death ensues, then the one who struck the blow shall be put to death; that person is a murderer; the avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when they meet.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if someone pushes another suddenly without enmity or hurls any object without lying in wait,
speaker: Narrator

text: or, while handling any stone that could cause death, unintentionally drops it on another and death ensues, though they were not enemies and no harm was intended,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood, in accordance with these ordinances,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the congregation shall rescue the slayer from the avenger of blood. Then the congregation shall send the slayer back to the original city of refuge. The slayer shall live in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the slayer shall at any time go outside the bounds of the original city of refuge
speaker: Narrator

text: and is found by the avenger of blood outside the bounds of the city of refuge and is killed by the avenger, no bloodguilt shall be incurred.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the slayer must remain in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest, but after the death of the high priest the slayer may return to his property.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These things shall be a statute and ordinance for you throughout your generations wherever you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If anyone kills another, the murderer shall be put to death on the evidence of witnesses, but no one shall be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover you shall accept no ransom for the life of a murderer who is subject to the death penalty; a murderer must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor shall you accept ransom for one who has fled to a city of refuge, enabling the fugitive to return to live in the land before the death of the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not pollute the land in which you live, for blood pollutes the land, and no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not defile the land in which you live, in which I also dwell, for I the Lord dwell among the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The heads of the ancestral houses of the clans of the descendants of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh, of the Josephite clans, came forward and spoke in the presence of Moses and the leaders, the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelites;
speaker: Narrator

text: they said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the Israelites, and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they are married into another Israelite tribe, then their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our ancestors and added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry, so it will be taken away from the allotted portion of our inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Jubilee of the Israelites comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they have married, and their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our ancestral tribe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded the Israelites according to the word of the Lord, saying, “The descendants of the tribe of Joseph are right in what they are saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying: Let them marry whom they think best; only it must be into a clan of their father’s tribe that they are married,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that no inheritance of the Israelites shall be transferred from one tribe to another, for all Israelites shall retain the inheritance of their ancestral tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the Israelites shall marry one from the clan of her father’s tribe, so that all Israelites may continue to possess their ancestral inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: No inheritance shall be transferred from one tribe to another, for each of the tribes of the Israelites shall retain its own inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, married sons of their father’s brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were married into the clans of the descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of their father’s clan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commandments and the ordinances that the Lord commanded through Moses to the Israelites in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
